text.p: Here are highlights of stories in Romania's press on Thursday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy:
ADEVARUL
- South Korea's Daewoo opened a fully licensed bank in Romania.
- The collapse of state-run animal farms will have serious economic effects, the paper says.
- Workers at the Avioane Craiova aircraft factory ended their strike.
EVENIMENTUL ZILEI
- Central bank governor Mugur Isarescu has confirmed rumours saying he might quit the job, the paper says.
- The government will discuss proposals by the transport ministry to levy a road tax on local motorists.
CURIERUL NATIONAL
- Transactions on RASDAQ reached a daily level of 10.0 billion lei.
General:
ROMANIA LIBERA
- Belgian Prime Minister Jean-Luc Dehaene is to make to make a four-day visit to Bucharest.
- Romania's President Emil Constantinescu had talks with parties represented in parliament on the Romanian-Ukrainian treaty.
Constantinescu said ratification of the the treaty must be done before the summit in Madrid, when newcomers to NATO are to be announced.
- The "Romanian Revolutionaries Association" will organise a rally in Bucharest to support Romania's bid to join NATO.
ADEVARUL
- Romania holds second place in Central and Eastern Europe on the number of children put in foster homes, a UNICEF report said, quoted by the paper.
CURIERUL NATIONAL
- Almost all parties represented in parliament will support the Romanian-Ukrainian treaty, the paper said.
- The paper also presents the reaction of party leaders regarding the treaty.
EVENIMENTUL ZILEI
- The paper says President Constantinescu is expected today to appoint the new boss of the Romanian Inteligence Service.
-- Bucharest Newsroom 40-1 3120264 ($=7,097 lei)
